channel.title: Indonesia on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Indonesia on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
smartfren Logo
PT Smartfren Telecom Tbk, commonly known as Smartfren, is an Indonesia-based wireless network operator headquartered in Central Jakarta. It is owned by Indonesian conglomerate Sinar Mas under the company PT Sinar Mas Komunikasi Teknologi. Smartfren operates exclusively using a 4G LTE network after shifting away from CDMA technologies in 2014. As of 2018, smarften has 10.1 million active subscribers, making them the fifth-largest wireless carrier in the country. Smartfren provides wireless voice and data services in Indonesia, which it claims is available in over 200 cities.
You can download thesmartfrenlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: smartfren
item.description: PT Smartfren Telecom Tbk, commonly known as Smartfren, is an Indonesia-based wireless network operator headquartered in Central Jakarta. It is owned by Indonesian conglomerate Sinar Mas under the company PT Sinar Mas Komunikasi Teknologi. Smartfren operates exclusively using a 4G LTE network after shifting away from CDMA technologies in 2014. As of 2018, smarften has 10.1 million active subscribers, making them the fifth-largest wireless carrier in the country. Smartfren provides wireless voice and data services in Indonesia, which it claims is available in over 200 cities.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Pakuwon Jati Logo
PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk is a Indonesian real estate developer based in Surabaya and the holding company of the Pakuwon Group. Pakuwon was founded by Alexander Tedja in 1982 and focus on the construction of shopping centers and office buildings in Surabaya and Jakarta. Pakuwon is a pioneer of the superblock concept in Indonesia, a large-scale integrated development in malls, offices, condominiums and hotels. Pakuwon owns and manages shopping centers such as Tunjungan Plaza superblocks, BBD Tower complex office, five-stars Sheraton Surabaya Hotel, Condominium and Laguna Indah real estate, as well as several industrial estates located in Surabaya metropolitan area.
You can download thePakuwon Jatilogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Pakuwon Jati
item.description: PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk is a Indonesian real estate developer based in Surabaya and the holding company of the Pakuwon Group. Pakuwon was founded by Alexander Tedja in 1982 and focus on the construction of shopping centers and office buildings in Surabaya and Jakarta. Pakuwon is a pioneer of the superblock concept in Indonesia, a large-scale integrated development in malls, offices, condominiums and hotels. Pakuwon owns and manages shopping centers such as Tunjungan Plaza superblocks, BBD Tower complex office, five-stars Sheraton Surabaya Hotel, Condominium and Laguna Indah real estate, as well as several industrial estates located in Surabaya metropolitan area.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Astra International Logo
Astra International is an Indonesian conglomerate controlled by Jardine Matheson. It is Southeast Asia’s largest independent automotive group. Operating predominantly in Indonesia, it is a provider of a full range of automobile and motorcycle products in partnerships with companies which include Toyota, Daihatsu, Isuzu, UD Trucks, Peugeot and BMW for automobiles, and Honda for motorcycles. Astra also has a strong presence in the automotive component sector through its subsidiary PT Astra Otoparts Tbk.
You can download theAstralogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Astra
item.description: Astra International is an Indonesian conglomerate controlled by Jardine Matheson. It is Southeast Asia’s largest independent automotive group. Operating predominantly in Indonesia, it is a provider of a full range of automobile and motorcycle products in partnerships with companies which include Toyota, Daihatsu, Isuzu, UD Trucks, Peugeot and BMW for automobiles, and Honda for motorcycles. Astra also has a strong presence in the automotive component sector through its subsidiary PT Astra Otoparts Tbk.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Indosat Logo
PT Indosat Tbk, doing business as Indosat Ooredoo since 2015 due to Ooredoo’s majority stake, is a telecommunications provider in Indonesia. The company offers wireless services for mobile phones, and to a lesser extent, broadband internet lines for homes. Indosat operates their wireless services under a few sub-brands, among them are IM3, Mentari, and Matrix. These brands differ by their payment model as well as pricing. Indosat also provides other services such as IDD, fixed telecommunications, and multimedia.
You can download theIndosatlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.description: PT Indosat Tbk, doing business as Indosat Ooredoo since 2015 due to Ooredoo’s majority stake, is a telecommunications provider in Indonesia. The company offers wireless services for mobile phones, and to a lesser extent, broadband internet lines for homes. Indosat also provides other services such as IDD, fixed telecommunications, and multimedia.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Polygon Bikes Logo Polygon Bikes is a bicycle’s trade name made by PT Insera Sena an Indonesian bicycle manufacturer based in Sidoarjo, East Java. Polygon operates manufacturing facilities in various places in Indonesia. Polygon has a globally connected design team, and commonly used as sponsor and its bike in bicycle competition. Source
You can download thePolygon Bikeslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Polygon Bikes
item.description: Polygon Bikes is a bicycle’s trade name made by PT Insera Sena an Indonesian bicycle manufacturer based in Sidoarjo, East Java. Polygon operates manufacturing facilities in various places in Indonesia. Polygon has a globally connected design team, and commonly used as sponsor and its bike in bicycle competition. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Wings Air Logo PT Wings Abadi Airlines, operating as Wings Air, is a scheduled commuter passenger low cost airline based in Surabaya, Indonesia. The airline operates out of Ngurah Rai International Airport in Bali as well as several other airports around Indonesia. The company was established as a short-haul regional flight service, wholly owned subsidiary of Lion Air and started operations on July 10, 2003. Source
You can download theWings Airlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Wings Air
item.description: PT Wings Abadi Airlines, operating as Wings Air, is a scheduled commuter passenger low cost airline based in Surabaya, Indonesia. The airline operates out of Ngurah Rai International Airport in Bali as well as several other airports around Indonesia. The company was established as a short-haul regional flight service, wholly owned subsidiary of Lion Air and started operations on July 10, 2003. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Garuda Indonesia Logo
Garuda Indonesia is the flag carrier of Indonesia, headquartered at Soekarno–Hatta International Airport. A successor of KLM Interinsulair Bedrijf, it is a member of SkyTeam and the second-largest airline of Indonesia after Lion Air, operating scheduled flights to a number of destinations across Asia, Europe, and Australia from its hubs, focus cities, as well as other cities for Hajj. It is the only Indonesian airline that flies to the European airspace.
You can download theGaruda Indonesialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Garuda Indonesia
item.description: Garuda Indonesia is the flag carrier of Indonesia, headquartered at Soekarno–Hatta International Airport. A successor of KLM Interinsulair Bedrijf, it is a member of SkyTeam and the second-largest airline of Indonesia after Lion Air, operating scheduled flights to a number of destinations across Asia, Europe, and Australia from its hubs, focus cities, as well as other cities for Hajj. It is the only Indonesian airline that flies to the European airspace.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lion Air Logo
PT Lion Mentari Airlines, operating as Lion Air, is an Indonesian low-cost airline. Based in Jakarta, Lion Air is the country’s largest privately run airline, the second largest low-cost airline in Southeast Asia and the largest airline of Indonesia. With Wings Air and Batik Air, Lion Group is the country’s largest airline’s group. The airline operates domestic as well as international routes, which connects different destinations of Indonesia to Singapore, the Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand, Australia, India, Japan and Saudi Arabia, as well as charter routes to Mainland China, Hong Kong, South Korea and Macau, with more than 630 flights per day.
You can download theLion Airlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Lion Air
item.description: PT Lion Mentari Airlines, operating as Lion Air, is an Indonesian low-cost airline. Based in Jakarta, Lion Air is the country’s largest privately run airline, the second largest low-cost airline in Southeast Asia and the largest airline of Indonesia. With Wings Air and Batik Air, Lion Group is the country’s largest airline’s group. The airline operates domestic as well as international routes, which connects different destinations of Indonesia to Singapore, the Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand, Australia, India, Japan and Saudi Arabia, as well as charter routes to Mainland China, Hong Kong, South Korea and Macau, with more than 630 flights per day.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Tokopedia Logo
Tokopedia is an Indonesian technology company specializing in e-commerce. It was founded in 2009 by William Tanuwijaya and Leontinus Alpha Edison. It is an Indonesian unicorn along with ride hailing company Gojek, travel service firm Traveloka, e-commerce Bukalapak and fintech company OVO. Source
You can download theTokopedialogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Pertamina Logo
PT Pertamina (Persero) or Pertamina (was Perusahaan Pertambangan Minyak dan Gas Bumi Negara, lit. ‘State Oil and Natural Gas Mining Company’) is an Indonesian state-owned oil and natural gas corporation based in Jakarta. It was created in August 1968 by the merger of Pertamin (established 1961) and Permina (established 1957). The firm is currently (2013) the second-largest crude oil producer in Indonesia behind the US-based Chevron Pacific Indonesia. In 2013 for the first time, Pertamina ranked no.
You can download thePertaminalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Pertamina
item.description: PT Pertamina (Persero) or Pertamina (was Perusahaan Pertambangan Minyak dan Gas Bumi Negara, lit. ‘State Oil and Natural Gas Mining Company’) is an Indonesian state-owned oil and natural gas corporation based in Jakarta. It was created in August 1968 by the merger of Pertamin (established 1961) and Permina (established 1957). The firm is currently (2013) the second-largest crude oil producer in Indonesia behind the US-based Chevron Pacific Indonesia. In 2013 for the first time, Pertamina ranked no.
